results.adx_keywords: Swimming;Rescues;Coaches and Managers;Alvarez, Anita (1996- );Fuentes, Andrea (1983- );Budapest (Hungary)
results.title: She Fainted During the World Championships. Her Coach Came to the Rescue.
results.abstract: Anita Alvarez, an American artistic swimmer, lost consciousness while performing her solo routine in Budapest. She was “fine” afterward, her coach said.

media.caption: Anita Alvarez, an American swimmer, was rescued from the bottom of the pool during the world championships in Budapest on Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Rumors and Misinformation;Birx, Deborah L;Trump, Donald J;Atlas, Scott W;United States
results.title: Deborah Birx Says Trump White House Asked Her to Weaken Covid Guidance
results.abstract: The former White House coronavirus coordinator, who became a controversial figure, said there was a consistent effort to stifle information as virus cases surged in late 2020.

media.caption: Dr. Deborah L. Birx, President Donald J. Trump’s coronavirus response coordinator, told a congressional panel on Thursday that the Trump administration’s attitude toward the coronavirus had caused a “false sense of security in America.”
media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Primaries and Caucuses;United States Politics and Government;Conservatism (US Politics);Income Inequality;Midterm Elections (2022);Boebert, Lauren;Trump, Donald J;Aspen (Colo);Colorado
results.title: In Boebert’s District, as Elsewhere, Democrats Surge Into G.O.P. Primary
results.abstract: Thousands of Democrats in Western Colorado are voting in the primary on Tuesday against Representative Lauren Boebert, part of a broader effort to defeat far-right Republicans.

media.caption: “The center has got to re-emerge,” said Tom Morrison, center, a lifelong Democrat in rural Pitkin County who voted for the Republican candidate Don Coram, not only in protest of Representative Lauren Boebert but also of what he called a rising concern about his party’s leftward drift.
media.copyright: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times

results.abstract: Ms. Cheney, who faces a Trump-backed challenger, has begun mailing Wyoming Democrats instructions on how to change their party affiliation.

results.title: Government to Cancel $6 Billion in Student Loans for Defrauded Borrowers
results.abstract: Around 200,000 who sought relief after attending schools that the Education Department said showed signs of “substantial misconduct” will have their federal student loans wiped out.

results.title: Psychosis, Addiction, Chronic Vomiting: As Weed Becomes More Potent, Teens Are Getting Sick
results.abstract: With THC levels close to 100 percent, today’s cannabis products are making some teenagers highly dependent and dangerously ill.

results.title: Their Baby Died. Then a Boston Hospital Lost the Body.
results.abstract: Everleigh McCarthy was less than 2 weeks old when she died at Brigham and Women’s Hospital in 2020. The police said her remains were “probably mistaken as soiled linen” and discarded.

media.caption: Daniel McCarthy and Alana Ross had gone through two miscarriages when they learned she was pregnant with Everleigh in February 2020. The couple have filed a lawsuit against Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

results.title: After Decades of Searching, 1898 Film of New Orleans Mardi Gras Is Found

results.title: An Outbreak of Meningococcal Disease in Florida Is Growing, the C.D.C. Says
results.abstract: So far, 26 cases, including seven deaths, have been identified, primarily in men who have sex with men.

media.caption: Neisseria meningitidis, the bacterium that causes meningitis, is typically spread through close or prolonged contact.
